meanings.definition: A person who manages or looks after something.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper fed the animals every day.
meanings.sent2: The keeper of the keys made sure all doors were locked at night.
meanings.sent3: The keeper of the garden accidentally watered the fake plants.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of secrets, never revealing what she knew.
meanings.sent5: As the keeper of the lighthouse, he ensured ships stayed safe from the rocks.

meanings.definition: A person who guards or protects something.
meanings.sent1: The security guard is the keeper of the museum artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The keeper of the forest protected the endangered species from harm.
meanings.sent3: The keeper of the treasure chest pretended to be a fearsome pirate.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of the ancient ruins, preserving their history.
meanings.sent5: The keeper of the peace ensured that everyone followed the rules.

meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for taking care of something.
meanings.sent1: The babysitter is the keeper of the children while their parents are away.
meanings.sent2: The keeper of the garden tended to the plants with care.
meanings.sent3: The keeper of the cookies had to resist eating them all.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of the family traditions, passing them down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The keeper of the time capsule ensured it was buried safely for future generations.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a sports team.
meanings.sent1: The coach is the keeper of the soccer team's strategy.
meanings.sent2: The keeper of the basketball team trained the players rigorously.
meanings.sent3: The keeper of the chess club always had a winning move up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of the track team's records, inspiring new athletes.
meanings.sent5: The keeper of the swim team motivated everyone to give their best in every race.

meanings.definition: A device or container used for storing or preserving something.
meanings.sent1: The cookie jar is the keeper of all the sweet treats.
meanings.sent2: The thermos is the keeper of hot soup on a cold day.
meanings.sent3: The freezer is the keeper of ice cream, always ready for a scoop.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of the family recipes, ensuring they were passed down.
meanings.sent5: The safe is the keeper of valuable documents and precious jewels.
